intro: Saldania acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiny-capsuled saldania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that becomes woody and spiny as it matures, providing protection for the seeds. Saldania acanthocarpa is often found in rocky or well-drained soils in woodland and mountainous regions.
